dt: {bc}a room or set of rooms below the ground floor of a building {bc}{sx|basement||}
{bc}the lowest place in the standings (as of an athletic league)

dt.t: The team spent most of last year in the {wi}cellar{/wi}.

et: Middle English {it}celer{/it} "storeroom, underground chamber," borrowed from Anglo-French, "storeroom," going back to Latin {it}cellārium{/it}, from {it}cella{/it} "store, larder, small room" + {it}-ārium{/it} {et_link|-ary:1|-ary:1}
shortdef: a room or set of rooms below the ground floor of a building : basement
a room for storing wines : wine cellar

dt: {bc}to put or keep (something, such as wine or cheese) in a cellar for storage or aging

dt.t: Each batch is handmade to achieve a delicate soft texture, then {wi}cellared{/wi} for a month to complete the aging …

dt: {bc}to be stored in a cellar {bc}to undergo aging while being stored in a cellar

dt.t: Perfectly drinkable now, but will {wi}cellar{/wi} nicely for another 3–5 years.

shortdef: to put or keep (something, such as wine or cheese) in a cellar for storage or aging
to be stored in a cellar : to undergo aging while being stored in a cellar

dt: {bc}a pit used for the storage especially of root crops

shortdef: a pit used for the storage especially of root crops

dt: {bc}a cellar or covered excavation designed for protection from dangerous windstorms (such as tornadoes)

shortdef: a cellar or covered excavation designed for protection from dangerous windstorms (such as tornadoes)

dt.t: The owner … hired the architect … to design and build a four-story building, with a raised basement and a {wi}subcellar{/wi} …
… the institute's … vault, the {wi}subcellar{/wi} archive with no windows …

shortdef: a cellar that is below another cellar : subbasement
a room for storing wines; also : a stock of wines
